body: We can compare the data type and SQL grammar between ShardingJDBC and H2 first. Then make a decision about this finally.

@peng-yongsheng @adriancole @jcchavezs @ascrutae 

I have finished the transfer codes. Zipkin spans -> SkyWalking Segment/Span/Ref.

Check the test here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/c9ba8bfbf6e534838b02cdbd8ad77001790cab33/apm-collector/apm-collector-thirdparty-receiver/receiver-zipkin/receiver-zipkin-provider/src/test/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/collector/receiver/zipkin/provider/transform/SpringSleuthSegmentBuilderTest.java#L131

The major transfer logic is here:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/c9ba8bfbf6e534838b02cdbd8ad77001790cab33/apm-collector/apm-collector-thirdparty-receiver/receiver-zipkin/receiver-zipkin-provider/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/collector/receiver/zipkin/provider/transform/SegmentBuilder.java#L52

Please provide your feedback.

FYI @liuhaoyang @candyleer Welcome to join too.
Shardingjdbc support SQL grammar,not support mysql dialect,for example “case when”.I have checked the sqls In h2 storage,Shardingjdbc not support keyword “or” only.
My proposal is, evaluate could use shardingjdbc implementor sql in H2, without change required. @chidaodezhongsheng What do you think?

> Shardingjdbc support SQL grammar,not support mysql dialect,for example “case when”.I have checked the sqls In h2 storage,Shardingjdbc not support keyword “or” only.

So I assume if the SQLs in ShardingSphere implementor, it should also work in H2 implementor. Do you know any risk or problem?

I checked the SQLs in H2 implementor, the keyword "or" that Shardingjdbc not support.Besides, it not support read meta data of DB.
In Shardingjdbc implementor, I use two sqls instead of the keyword "or". However, I cannot check the column meta data of table, I still not found the instead way.
If so, I prefer to separate the two implementors, don't depend on that. If compatible is not so good, codes will make people think strange.

Please check your local maven repository. According to Apache HTTPComponent official documents, this package existed from 4.0, see here: https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-core-ga/httpcore/apidocs/org/apache/http/HttpEntity.html

I don't think there is nothing related to 4.5.3 or 4.5.5

I finish the prototype of this feature. Here is how people to test this:

1. Download and build the project. 
1. Find `application.yml` in `apm-collector-boot` module, and open `receiver_zipkin` section in the yaml.
1. Install ElasticSearch 5.x(5.5 or 5.6), change the `elasticsearch.yml` like this: https://gist.github.com/wu-sheng/4f869fb465bbd15f0852fa923357b4a6
1. Find `CollectorBootStartUp#main` also in `apm-collector-boot` module, and startup.
1. Follow [build document](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/How-to-build.md#build-from-github) to package the source codes in this branch.
1. Find release in `dist` folder and enter `bin` folder to start up webapp by `webappService.sh`.
1. Access the Sleuth example. 

Right now, I use Caffeine as an expire checker, and it doesn't work well. So just ignore the following errors. Just access Spring Sleuth more than once. I usually set a timer in browser. I intend to replace Caffeine.

See apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/dubbo-plugin/pom.xml
The dependencies bring com.fasterxml.jackson version 2.8.11 which is affected by CVE-2018-7489
The only maintained streams of RestEasy at the moment are 3.5, 3.6 and master branch
Please upgrade the version of RestEasy your are using.
@jfclere This version should have the bad influence in running status, right? The Dubbo lib for this `Dubbo-plugin` is only compiling requirement.

I will try to find out. Many companies use old version Dubbo lib :) That is why we compile based on that. Alibaba just reactivated this project and donated to Apache Incubator too.

FYI @ascrutae Could we upgrade Dubbo to the latest version? I think we don't depend on many things. This version has some security issues.
@ascrutae Please help to check which version of `com.fasterxml.jackson` in the latest Dubbo release. If still stay unchanged, we should raise an issue.

i have solved this problem  ,the cause of  is  the configure of  ElasticSearch  , threadpool.bulk.size is too small

Not related to SB2 as I am having the same trouble with SB 1.5. The problem lies somewhere in our Spring Security initialization. The web auth module that does JWT auth is failing to initialize when I include the java agent.

Will have to see if I can reproduce this in an example as the application code and security is not shareable.

First, I am not familiar with that spring boot script, but in theory, you can check the os startup command by using 'ps -ef'.  If agent starts, you should see the log in agent/log. One thing you should notice, -javaagant need to be in the front of -jar. @ascrutae could you help about this?

For binding, i think you miss application.yml in collector conf folder, which includes all binding IPs and ports.. See collector cluster mode doc.

I can give you more details about the architecture.

1. Zookeeper is for collector cluster to detect each other. So agent don't need it. Collectors in cluster mode share the same zookeeper and elasticsearch cluster.
1. Agent always need some IPs and hosts to connect collector, right? What do you prefer to use? The IPs or hosts in your settings could be considered as service discovery service provided in cluster, agent uses this to query the real collector cluster IPs, and pick one in random. In agent settings, you could set more than one IP or hostname. Even use zookeeper in agent(of course we don't), you need the whole IPs of zookeeper. So there is no difference between set the collector IPs and set zookeeper IPs. In underlying, that is same service discovery mechanism.
1. I don't understand what is your meaning about central apm infra. APM backends need to collect, aggregate and analysis data, so, definitely they should run in a cluster. In any way, they must run a whole cluster. You can deploy collector in each VM and sharing the  same Zookeeper and elasticsearch, but I don't recommend that.

Hope this can help you to understand better.
You don't need to reboot agent to get new collector address, the collector naming service provided at the endpoint of you agent settings addresses. New cluster addresses list will be returned.

There is no central cluster node. Agent could connect anyone or some one in cluster, will get the full list finally.

And of course, this part is easy to enhance, if you have better solution for AWS.

I can provide this detail to help you guess what is really happening.

Each controller in your application will be added a new field for auto instrumentation, your log has mentioned it. So maybe your applucation security component will check the fields somehow. This is the potential cause.

Of source, skywalking wouldn't add any autoware annotation for that field, that should be normal harmness field. But in your case, it harms.

If you can pinpoint whats codes in your or spring in checking this, and how to check. We can provide more helps.

The above information helps. Let me dig in a little bit on this and then get back on this thread.

In the meantime, would like to know if skywalking can be configured to ignore some of these troublesome classes. For instance in this case the security library is developed by a third party. The application simply includes it in our dependency and plugs the custom JWT authentication.

By APM infrastructure I meant, skywalking modules comprised of Zk, Collector and ES. I am getting a good feel about how these components can discover themselves and form the quorum. This is perfect.

However the common problem that we have come across in our AWS VPC is that every hosted component is ephemeral in nature. They don't retain any state and in case of redeployments or failover they tend to come up as a new host, including new IP's. Now when we deploy the APM modules they are bound to have the same ephemeral nature. In case of a tear down/infra rebuild, due from datacenter failover, maintenance or upgrades, in some cases new hosts for Zk, Collector etc will be created and they are bound to have brand new IP's assigned.

Now all of a sudden the 100 odd skywalking java agents are going to freak out as there is no known Collectors available. Cant discover either as IP's of all Collectors have changed. At this point I don't see any other way than restart all my 100 applications (use puppet or ansiable) so that they register the new Collector IP's in the agent.conf.

If only we had a light weight stateless collector agent on each of these application hosts, they could have been restarted instead and the application is always configured to talk to this local collector agent. Sorry if I haven't been able to provide enough context on this issue.

Thanks for providing these detail info. As that, how do you think if we provide settings file change detected and  take effect at runtime? This is in our roadmap, I can speed up this feature.

If you want a sidecar, deployed at local, any http and grpc proxy could work.
@wu-sheng I can help you translate some documents.
Welcome for helping us. The Documents about deployment, optional plugins and incubating features have changed. You can see it from last several merges.

The TCP/gRPC proxy kind of makes sense. Will explore that option.

> The TCP/gRPC proxy kind of makes sense. Will explore that option.

For more details considered, just a proxy for naming HTTP service should be enough. Upstream of the proxy should the collector naming service list.

> I don't see a way to change this common code. Any chance we can configure skywalking to ignore classes for injection.

Do you use a pattern match in SpringMVC? Such as url=`product/order/{orderId}`? We provide SpringMVC plugin to support this scenario, otherwise, you can simply remove the SpringMVC plugin, Tomcat plugin will do the trace work.

If you are using, we have to change the source codes of SpringMVC, not too hard, but still to change and recompile at your local.

in general, things not defined (which many things are not) simply go into
the relevant namespace. ex skywalking.application-id or similar

Even `undertow` is unsupported, at least should not harm.
If you are using SpringMVC or Struts, there should not relate to HTTPs. If not, just servlet, maybe.
I use SpingBoot standalone and sprinboot+embedded tomcat

H2 storage is not support now, please use elasticsearch.
JFinal has its own tech stack. We haven't supported that. You can help for this, or ask JFinal community to contribute, like Ant SOFA team did.
I am asking about `SpringMVC`, do you use that?
Collector use tcp transport port 9300. 9200 is http rest port.

@gamefundas I had fix this issue in PR #1375

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/17605219/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/17605219)

Coverage decreased (-0.02%) to 24.463% when pulling **89436bccb6c532fd80b534736ef5eaa73285cfb3 on ascrutae:fix/spring-dependencies-check** into **aa9a89685a39e1006bb71be16a4e991eee21e0f1 on apache:master**.

The root cause about issue #1361 is the one of spring framework inject rule is that it according to the get/set method, and Skywalking Agent add the `getSkywalkingDynamicField/setSkywalkingDynamicField` method to each enhance class. So it will cause the spring framework attempt to inject the bean named `skywalkingDynamicField`, Definitely it will failed, because of no one will define that bean. 

To resolve this issue , We need to remove the `skywalkingDynamicField` property filed from the bean.

@liuhaoyang  Could you add the following line to the `netty-tcnative-boringssl-static` dependency package in  pom.xml of `apm-network` project and then repackage and try it.
```
<classifier>${os.detected.classifier}</classifier>
```

and Here is the example
```
<dependency>
     <groupId>io.netty</groupId>
     <artifactId>netty-tcnative-boringssl-static</artifactId>
     <version>2.0.7.Final</version>
     <classifier>${os.detected.classifier}</classifier>
</dependency>
```

Do you want to know the total throughputs? If so, and considering your throughput is low, less than 1 cpm in the whole day, you can't know that. 

If low throughput, don't try to choose the long duration. Because, in avg level, there is also zero.
